gov.usgs.anss.edgemom

Class EdgeBlockSocket

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • gov.usgs.anss.edgethread.EdgeThread
        • gov.usgs.anss.edgemom.EdgeBlockSocket
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class EdgeBlockSocket
extends EdgeThread
    EdgeBlockSocket.java - This thread is created by the EdgeBlockServer and serves data to one client. It takes data from the EdgeBlockQueue and forwards it to the client. It has a timeout to allow it to exit if the socket goes horribly wrong. This Thread is never created via the EdgeMom configuration file. 
     This EdgeThread uses the command line from the EdgeBlockServer that creates it.  Only the
 -dbg option is actually used by this class.
    Created on February, 2006, 3:12 PM

      • EdgeBlockSocket

        public EdgeBlockSocket(java.lang.String argline,
                       java.lang.String tag,
                       java.net.Socket ss,
                       EdgeThread parent)
        Creates a new instance of EdgeBlockSocket to send data to one client. This is normally created by EdgeBlockSocket so it must allow all of its argments as well as its own. right now on -dbg does anything
        Parameters:
        argline - The command line passed through from the EdgeBlockServer
        tag - The tag for output for this object.
        ss - The socket to use for this object
